intro: Wiborgia obcordata, commonly known as the heartleaf wiborgia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features small, yellow disc flowers surrounded by pale green to white ray florets. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Wiborgia obcordata is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its delicate appearance and ability to attract pollinators.
